definition: to raise a flag/to hoist a flag
to ascend/to rise to the rank of/to promote/to hoist/liter/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth dou 斗[dou3]
banner/flag/(in Qing times) Manchu (cf. 八旗[Ba1 qi2])/administrative subdivision in inner Mongolia equivalent to 縣|县[xian4] county/CL:面[mian4]
flag raising ceremony

sentences.english: They raise the national flag and the national hymn starts.
I am honored this year was selected as the flag raisers.
sentences.chinese: 我，今年很榮幸的被選爲升旗手。

sentences.english: First, I introduce our class rises the standard-bearer.
sentences.chinese: 今天我首先介紹我們班的升旗手。

sentences.english: I watched the Flag - raising Ceremony yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 昨天我去觀看升旗儀式了。

sentences.english: Do you have a flag raising ceremony?
Also called the flag-raising mountain and penang topography top, altitude 830 metres.

sentences.english: I can play the violin . Today , I'm very happy , thanks !

sentences.english: The flag- rasing ceremony of Shenzhen Futian Free Trade Zone Pirmary School now begins.
sentences.chinese: 深圳市福田保稅區小學第周升旗儀式現在開始。

sentences.english: Guards of honor convoy the national flag enter the site of the raising ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 儀仗兵護衛國旗進入升旗儀式現場。

sentences.english: National Day is commemorated every year by special flag-raising ceremonies.
sentences.chinese: 每一年的國慶節都是從特殊的升旗儀式開始慶祝的。

sentences.english: CSU members and invited guest attend Flag ceremony no charge.
sentences.chinese: 會員及貴賓參加升旗典禮者免費。

sentences.english: About 2, 600 people watched the flag-raising ceremony in the square.
sentences.chinese: 廣場上大約2，600人觀看了升旗儀式。

sentences.english: The week flag-raising ceremony of Liyuchi Primary school now is beginning.
sentences.chinese: 鯉魚池小學升旗儀式現在開始。

sentences.english: This week's flag raiser is . Let's welcome come him to the stage.
sentences.chinese: 本週升旗手是同學，現在請他出場。

sentences.english: This week hoisted a flag the ceremony finally to manage by our Class Two, Grade One.
sentences.chinese: 本週一的升旗儀式由我們初一年級二班來主持。
